intro: Leucopogon collinus var. billardierei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heaths. The plant is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit and small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, appearing in clusters during the spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
